Junicon 1.8.4 API

This documentation describes the classes and interfaces for Junicon, a Java-based interpreter for the Unicon programming language.

See: Description

Transformational interpreter 
Package Description
edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.interpreter
The Interpreter package provides support for transformational interpretation of a source programming language.
edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.parser
The Parser package defines an abstract parser used by the transformational interpreter, and a generic end-of-statement detector.
edu.uidaho.junicon.interpreter.transformer
The Transformer package provides classes and interfaces for general XSLT-based transformation.
Grammars 
Package Description
edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.common
This package provides a parser wrapper around the javacc-generated parser.
edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.document
The Document package provides support for creating and slicing XML documents.
edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.javacc
This package provides common wrappers and visitor classes for the javacc generated parser.
edu.uidaho.junicon.grammars.junicon
This package contains the javacc-generated parser for the Junicon language, as well as its preprocessor.
Substrates, language specific sub-interpreters 
Package Description
edu.uidaho.junicon.substrates.groovy.groovyshell
Provides an altered version of a Groovy script engine, to correct static import handling in the default Groovy ScriptEngine implementation.
edu.uidaho.junicon.substrates.groovy.iterators
Convert Groovy closures to Java lambda expressions, using Function, VariadicFunction and Callable.
edu.uidaho.junicon.substrates.junicon
Contains the customized Junicon interpreter.
Runtime support 
Package Description
edu.uidaho.junicon.runtime.junicon.annotations
Contains annotation interfaces for class, method, operator, built-in function, and &-keyword metadata.
edu.uidaho.junicon.runtime.junicon.constructs
Contains the implementation of the Unicon control constructs.
edu.uidaho.junicon.runtime.junicon.iterators
Contains the implementation of the iterator calculus kernel.
edu.uidaho.junicon.runtime.junicon.operators
Contains the implementation of Unicon operators, functions, and &keywords.
edu.uidaho.junicon.runtime.util
Provides common utilities for logging and file copying.
Transform support 
Package Description
edu.uidaho.junicon.support.transforms
Provides supporting methods used by XSLT transforms.

This documentation describes the classes and interfaces for Junicon, a Java-based interpreter for the Unicon programming language. Unicon is a unique object-oriented dynamic language that supports goal-directed evaluation of generator expressions. Junicon is implemented using program transformation onto another scripting language, Groovy, that runs under Java. The result is a transformational interpreter for goal-directed evaluation that has seamless integration with Java. Junicon can function either as an interactive line-by-line interpreter, or as a tool that can translate its input to Java for compilation.

The transformational interpreter works by first parsing the source language into a decorated XML abstract syntax tree. A series of transforms then take the XML language representation into its substrate equivalent. The program is first normalized into a familiar form more amenable to translation to Java, by flattening nested generators and making iteration explicit. The normalized Junicon program is then transformed into a Java class with expressions translated into calls on the Junicon runtime. Lastly, the XML tree is deconstructed back into the target Java language, and then the result is piped into the the Groovy scripting engine. The interpreter can function in several modes, either as an interactive line-by-line interpreter, or as a tool that can transform its input directly to Java.

Support is also provided for correlating error messages back into the original source language, so as to enable debugging and tracing.

The Junicon Interpreter is composed of the:

  • Interactive shell,
  • Parser and grammars, including the preprocessor,
  • Transformer that runs XSLT scripts, as well as supporting Java classes used by the XSLT scripts,
  • Startup scripts, including a Groovy prelude and a Unicon startup script,
  • Runtime Java classes for Junicon operators, functions, and-keywords, constructs, and the iterator calculus kernel.
